title: The State Hermitage Museum
description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world, founded in 1764.

title: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood
description: A Russian Orthodox church built on the site where Emperor Alexander II was assassinated.

title: Peter and Paul Fortress
description: The original citadel of St. Petersburg, founded by Peter the Great in 1703.

title: St. Isaac's Cathedral
description: The largest Russian Orthodox cathedral in the city, dedicated to Saint Isaac of Dalmatia.

title: Nevsky Prospect
description: The main street of St. Petersburg, running through the historical center.

title: Mariinsky Theatre
description: A historic theatre of opera and ballet, founded in 1860.

title: Russian Museum
description: The largest depository of Russian fine art in Saint Petersburg.

title: Summer Garden
description: The oldest park in Saint Petersburg, founded in 1704 by Peter the Great.

title: Kazan Cathedral
description: A cathedral dedicated to Our Lady of Kazan, modeled after St. Peter's Basilica in Rome.

title: Palace Square
description: The central city square of St. Petersburg, site of many historical events.
